Question: This person was vocal in criticising the media treatment of the Clinton campaign as sexist.
Hints: In the late 1950s, this person spent two years in India as a Chester Bowles Asian Fellow.
This person was named the American Humanist Association's 2012 Humanist of the Year for her activism in feminism and LGBT rights.
This person's broader argument "was that the media and the political world are too admiring of militarism in all its guises.".
